Vecindar

• Home View

  • Side bar menu when user is logged in

  • Side bar menu when no user logged in

  • Register Form

  • Login Form

  • Create new project. Add budget breakdowns

  • Add images to new project

  • Pictures added to new project

  • View projects nearby you

  • View description of projects and their current status / phase

  • Contribute to these community projects using ATH Movil

Inspiration

Nowadays, people live disengaged from their physical community. They have issues creating ties with those who live close to them. This not only makes coexisting challenging but it eliminates very important support networks and community help. They feel indifferent and insecure about their community and its future. They expect changes but they have no idea how to make them happen. We, Vecindar seeks to better and to unite the community by providing a platform to create and fund collaborative projects.

What it does

This mobile application facilitates and promotes community project creation. It lets anyone view important projects in their specific community. Thirdly, we would work as a non-profit by managing the money transactions using ATH móvil and creating ties with workers and employers and buying materials. We are essentially establishing a democratic way of financing community projects. In addition, we are promoting the use of unused community spaces.

How we built it

We built an iOS app using Swift and Parse as backend as a service. We worked together to come up with solutions for the design of the app. We motivated each other to keep going until we had a product we were proud of.

Challenges we ran into

It is an ambitious project and a big part of it was figuring out the legal and financial aspect of the application.

Accomplishments that we're proud of

We were able to come up with an idea with the potential to better connections in communities and make them better. Also, we finished our first hackathon and came out with knowledge, motivation and incentive to create more.

What we learned

It was our first hackathon. We learned so much while having fun. We learned our limits and capabilities. We learned how to create something from scratch in a quick but effective way.

What's next for Vecindar

After this hackathon, we want to push forward this project. We need a website and an android app. We feel a commenting section would be beneficial and some search features. Also we need a way of visualizing the progress of a project before it's completed. Partnering up with an association with a goal like this would be ideal, we are open to collaborating to someone who has the same vision of better communities in Puerto Rico.

Built With

  • swift
  • xcode
  • parse

Hauler

Inspiration

Lawyers must go through long processes, by paper, to request bike messengers to transport important packages or documents.

What it does

The system consists of a Web Page where lawyers can locate and request bike messengers and sending them sender and receiver data. The bike messengers will have access to a mobile App, where they can see their current requests and either accept or decline them. If accepted, the messenger will follow a series of steps: pick up package, deliver package, request payment, and verify payment.

How we built it

For the Web Page we used Angular Material Design, Google Maps API, ATH Movil API, nodeJS, HTML, CSS, heroku, json, npm, bootstrap, and bower. For the server we used nodeJS, ExpressJs, heroku, npm, http-request, and json. For the iOS App we used Swift and Xcode.

Challenges we ran into

Push Notifications on iOS App were not reaching the device.

Accomplishments that we're proud of

We stayed till the end.

What we learned

Swift and how to send Push Notifications through a desktop console.

What's next for Hauler

Implement cost-distance algorithm, generate DB, and Android deployment.

Crazy Cube

• Main Menu

  • Easy Mode

  • Medium Mode

  • Hard Mode

Inspiration

In previous hackathon's I worked with programmers of the same skill level as mine. However, this year I decided to work with two beginners and teach them a little about basic web development. They had great ideas, and we managed to develop a solid game. They learned the basic idea of web development, and what is needed to master it.

What it does

The game was inspired by a Rubik's cube that was sitting on our desk. We decided to create a grid similar to the cube, however, the game tells you a color and the user has to tap it as fast as they can to gain some score.

How we built it

Everything was built from scratch. No fancy frameworks, just pure coding. All of the code was developed by me, but all the ideas, art designs, colors, game logic came from my team mates

Challenges we ran into

We wanted the game to fit into a phone screen, however we didn't have the time to fit accordingly. We also ran into frame rate issues in our phones, when running the game.

Accomplishments that we're proud of

My team experienced their first hackathon ever, and I couldn't be prouder of what we accomplished.

What we learned

We learned that basic ideas can become really fun and challenging. Specially, when it's the first time seeing it.

What's next for Crazy Cube

Currently is been hosted on a server for all of our friends to try it out! =)

Bayú

• Bayú

Inspiration

Make something cool and fun where people could participate.

What it does

Provides a way to create music in real-time from anywhere in the world.

How we built it

Leveraged WebSocket technology to push sounds to users in real-time. Used in memory key value store Redis to keep track of assigned instruments and used a combination of HTML5 Audio API and D3.js visualization library to play and visualize the sound.

Playing and visualizing multiple sounds/instruments at the same time.

Accomplishments that we're proud of

Visualizing multiple sounds at the same time and implementing a crowed-sourced real-time music platform.

WIMPS (Where Is My Parking Spot?!)

• Our budget is small, so we use small everything.

  • There's always those a$$%*/#$...

  • IT LIIIIIVES!!!! Dx

  • INDEED, IT LIVES!!!!!

Inspiration

It's always hard to find parking at places like school or busy malls. Sometimes, you just need to know if it's worth venturing into a lot.

What it does

Displays available parking spots on a map, for a properly set-up parking area.

How we built it

#notGonnaShareTradeSecrets (Just kidding, I'll post some of that later. :) ) TL;DR: Using OpenCV, a webcam detects parking, then detects extraneous objects that block each parking. If the state of a spot changes, it is sent to the server, which forwards the status to clients.

Challenges we ran into

Never used OpenCV before... that's something...

Accomplishments that we're proud of

It sort of works! XD

EDIT: IT LIIIIIVES!

What we learned

How to use the Google Maps API geometry library (for that strange spherical stuff that goes on atop our big, "round" spaceship). Lots of other stuff... gotta go code... BRB.

What's next for WIMPS (Where Is My Parking Spot?!)

  1. Voice interaction BECAUSE YOU'RE DRIVING AND SHOULDN'T BE LOOKING AT THE PHONE.
  2. A$$%*/# detection for people who take more than the SUPER REASONABLE ONE SPOT/CAR. The offending image is tweeted to our hall of shame.
  3. "DUDE, where's my car?"
  4. Availability (as a percentage) prediction by time and day of week.

Built With

  • opencv
  • azure
  • python
  • express.js
  • google-maps
  • jade
  • coffee
  • hotwheels
  • numpy
Hi! I'm working on the computer vision and physical world interfacing (Empty spot detection and state change reporting, which gets sent to the server / db). Gonna take a nap now... x)
I worked on the server and user interface. App was deployed on Azure. Server was set up using ExpressJS and socket.io. Client-side uses Google Maps API for UI and spherical geometry calculations.
Census Tract housing Median Price Estimator

What it does

This Jupyter notebook uses a machine learning technique known as linear regression to learn how to calculate the median value of a housing unit based on 80% of the data obtained from the census acs5 survey. The model generated from the 80 % of the data is then applied to the remaining 20% of the data to validate that the model generalizes.

What's next for Census Tract housing Median Price Estimator

Using real CRIM data?

HackPR2016

In order to help others (and by others we mean high school students mainly) in their time of need we worked hard 24 hours full of coffee in our blood. This application called MathHack provides the users a fun text based program so that they can practice basic pre-calculus problems to further develop their success.

Aside from hard work for over 24 hours the program whole was created during the hackathon of HackPR where we created 19 classes these classes consist of the many features in the program, to name a few we created exercise generators responsible for (you guessed it!) generating exercises with random number generators in order to provide a never ending examples of math problems. Other features created include the many menus, history and even difficulty for the game so that even the most experienced mathematicians can have fun playing such a fun game.

The whole program is made by using java.

LUCI - Microsoft Bot Framework, GFR Media & DeShow API

Chatbot LUCI for HackPR

LUCI stands for :

Lexical Undersating Capable Intelligence

Lucy was a lady who worked at companyx. She left from Puerto Rico to Orlando leaving companyx customers unattended and her desk desolate. So LUCI was made to take care of the backlog of work. It is an AI bot made using the Microsoft Bot Framework, DeShow API and the GFR Media API to fetch information and create context of the users that used to write to Lucy. Lucy now lives in Kissimee Florida while LUCI reduces backlog of work.

The USE CASE showcased is a chatbot that responds to the users'questions.

ATH Móvil Payments

• Example web store

  • Checkout with ATH Móvil

  • QR code with order details is generated

  • QR is read by mobile device and the order is processed

  • Custom ATH Móvil implementation for processing payments.

  • Example store

  • Example item, user clicks on pay with ATH Móvil

  • ATH Móvil is launched so that payments can be made directly from the app. Seller info is sent through an intent.

Inspiration

Last year's ATH Móvil weren't very innovative according to one of our team members. He wanted to give this year's API a really good try!

What it does

ATH Móvil Payments extends ATH Móvil's API so that it can used for eCommerce websites and mobile applications.

How we built it

By studying the API, we identified its virtues and limitations. With this in mind, we structured a complimentary API that extends ATH Móvil's functionalities. Combining the two APIs we created a mobile SDK that allows users to buy from mobile apps using ATH Móvil, and the Javascript SDK that allows doing the same for eCommerce sites.

We used various software such as Nodal for the complimentary API, Ionic framework to create APIs for both iOS and Android and various text-editors such as XCODE, WebStorm, Sublime Text, Android Studio, Brackets.

Challenges we ran into

We misunderstood parts of the API and had to do some last minute changes.

Accomplishments that we're proud of

We've developed a simple, and yet secure, extension for ATH Móvil.

What we learned

Using Ionic we learned much about good practices in Angular JS. We're also better now at timing our projects.

What's next for ATH Móvil Payments

Implement this in the official ATH Móvil system. It would allow for a wider user base and promote use of the app.

Bizpay

Inspiration

The inspiration that we had to create this website was the need to provide businesses a way to receive payments form their clients and pay their employees through "ATH-Móvil" in an easy, low-cost and seamless way.

What it does

Bizpay is a website that allows businesses to receive payments from its clients and pay all its employees through a website console. It is specifically built to help make these processes easier and more organized using "ATH-Móvil’s" platform and API’s. It is basically a concept of what we think “ATH-Móvil business” should look like in its web client and the features it should include.

How we built it

We built it by first, designing the website based on a dashboard interface. Then, we integrated programing languages such as HTML, CSS and JavaScript to build the apps interface. After that, we made a database of information and integrated “ATH Móvil’s” API to make it all work.

Challenges we ran into

The biggest challenges were integrating the API, building a solid business plan and designing the webpage.

Accomplishments that we're proud of

We are proud of every single aspect of the webpage. Everything works amazingly.

What we learned

We learned a lot about integrating into our website frameworks such as polymer, design guidelines like material design, API’s, how to get the API to work with our project and polished our other abilities further such as programing in CSS, HTML and JavaScript.

What's next for Bizpay

The next challenge for Bizpay is integrate it into "Ath Móvil" and expand the different options the platform will offer in conjunction with “ATH Móvil”.

Challenge 2 - Estadística

• Calculadora COLI

HackPR 2016

Team: Howard Martínez, Marcos Antolí, Cristian Garzón, Khalan Jones.

Frameworks: Bootstrap, Play, React Libraries: Select2, Chart.js

Puerto Rico Institute of Statistics - Challenge #2:

  • Create a personalized Cost Of Living Index calculator The Puerto Rico Institute of Statistics gathers data that allows the San Juan Metro Area to participate in the Cost-of-Living Index (COLI) of the Council for Community and Economic Research (C2ER). COLI is prepared using prices from a selected group of 57 specific products. The results are shared with users through a “COLI calculator”; see for example here. These products were chosen many years ago to be representative of the consumption of middle-to-upper class professional households. However, not every individual will choose to buy all 57 specific products. Therefore, there is an interest to be able to allow the data user to select which categories are of interest to their particular circumstances. In this challenge, teams will develop a COLI calculator that allows individuals to select which of the 57 categories are relevant to their circumstances, the app will calculate the resulting COLI index and allow the user to determine their comparable salary in one of the other almost 300 regions where COLI is calculated.

HackPR - El Nuevo Dia News Bot

HackPR-El Nuevo Dia News Bot

A news bot that consumes data using the El Nuevo Dia GFR Media API.

Commands

The commands are for the bot are created in a way that allows easy integration/removal of commands. Available commands:

  1. Horoscope
  2. Latest
  3. Lottery
  4. Opinions
  5. Social Feed
  6. News

Built With

  • c#
  • .net
  • microsoft-bot

ATH Móvil Business

Inspiration

Requesting money is an efficient and polite way of asking for money you're owed. Whether it's for a job you did or an event you organized. Use ATH Móvil Business to send a payment requests to any client using ATH Móvil.

What it does

ATH Móvil Business will allow any business request payments to their clients using their phone number. Clients will receive a notification with the requested payment information.

How we built it

This mobile app was built using Android for the front-end development, and a NodeJS server with a MongoDB database in the back-end. Authentication and payments are made using the ATH Móvil API.

Challenges we ran into

There were a lot of compatibility issues between the some of the libraries we wanted to use.

Accomplishments that we're proud of

Building a functional API that allows business to request payments and track clients and transactions from a mobile app. Businesses are also able to view comprehensive reports about their client activities.

What we learned

How to develop complex graphs using the Android native language and new technologies that allowed us to optimize the overall functionalities of our application.

What's next for ATH Móvil Business

Making the ATH Móvil App fully compatible with ATH Móvil Business to allow better user interaction between both apps and making the whole experience of paying with ATH Móvil even more seamless.

Built With

  • node.js
  • android
  • mongodb
  • javascript
  • java

I worked on the android client in the aesthetic and conceptual design of the application. I had new challenges in this experience, working with parts of the API that I had never experienced and integrating native graphics.
AgroCam

Inspiration

There has been a deficiency on agriculture lately, with this project we aim to solve this problem by creating an autonomous system to help cultivate a home farm.

What it does

In this project we worked on a system that's able to identify several plants with the use of computer vision. This was achieved by using machine learning and color recognition algorithms.

How we built it

The system was built in Raspberry Pi with Python code and the use of Open CV and SK Learn Libraries.

Challenges we ran into

Setting up the Raspberry Pi for this use. Building the models and creating an outline of the plants.

Accomplishments that we're proud of

The code is able to successfully detect through a live feed the plant that is presented to the camera. And accurately identifying and displaying its name.

What we learned

We learned to work with open cv and how to use the sk learn libraries. These libraries were used for computer vision and machine learning respectively. They allowed us to create the models so the code can identify what plant it is and using color recognition to draw an outline of the plant.

What's next for AgroCam

Add more models and make the code more precise. Make the system cognitive mounting the system in a robot that can cultivate and maintain the crops in the home farm.

Built With

  • raspberry-pi
  • python
  • opencv
  • sklearn

Try it out

  • github.com
